name.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Vind: Keyboard Shortcuts for Every Website

short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Create keyboard shortcuts for any web element. Boost productivity, eliminate mouse clicks, navigate faster on all sites.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
‚ôªÔ∏è 3.2 Changelog ‚ôªÔ∏è üéâ Vind is finally a keyboardless experience üéâ
‚úÖ You can now configure an extension shortcut to start the binding process (ü•¥ shortcuts within shortcuts ü•¥)
  - To set it up go to chrome://extensions/shortcuts, find Vind and set the shortcut for "Create a new keyboard shortcut binding". You'll see you can also configure a binding for opening the Vind popup and Vind's options.

‚ôªÔ∏è 3.1 Changelog ‚ôªÔ∏è
‚úÖ You can now change a Binding's mapped key in settings.
‚úÖ Minor bug fixes

‚ôªÔ∏è 3.0 Changelog ‚ôªÔ∏è
‚úÖ With 3.0 we've redesigned the engine that makes Vind remember the elements of your bindings should click from the ground up. On new bindings you should now stop seeing so many "The element does not exist" errors.
‚úÖ When you hover over a Binding in the Popup, Vind will highlight the element it maps to.
‚úÖ We've fixed a bug that rendered the whole page unresponsive when trying to bind an element.

The Last Keyboard Shortcut Extension You'll Ever Need.
Vind is a powerhouse keyboard shortcut engine that lets you bind buttons to keys effortlessly.
Supercharge your productivity by mapping keys to any on-screen element and trigger clicks with a single press.

Ditch the mouse, ride the wind üå™Ô∏è

NOTE: Vind is still under development. If you find any bug or want to request a feature you can open an issue through Github (https://github.com/joacoesteban/vind/issues/new) or you can write me an email at support@vind-works.io. Your feedback is apreciated!

If you find a bug please send me an email at support@vind-works.io or you can also create an issue on the github page (https://github.com/JoacoEsteban/vind/issues)
